summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons inmate roster and daily log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9, 2019. It lists hundreds of inmates with their registration numbers, names, assignment dates, and housing locations. The roster includes Jeffrey Epstein, who is listed as being in custody with a 'PRE' (Present) status in housing unit K04N. The document also includes a daily log showing inmate movements and an official out-count form. This document is a collection of administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from August 2019. It includes daily logs, inmate rosters, out-count forms, and count sheets detailing inmate movements, assignments, and population counts. The records show Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate assigned to a specific housing unit (Z04-206LAD) for attorney visits. This document is a series of Federal Bureau of Prisons chain of custody logs for evidence collected from Jeffrey Epstein's cell and related locations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019, following his death. It includes logs for 30-minute rounds sheets, an attorney conference log book, and clothing Epstein was transported in, documenting the evidence handling process. This document contains Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 13, 2019, including TRUINTEL log entries, official count slips, inmate rosters, and an evidence recovery log. The records detail inmate counts and housing unit activities around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, showing standard prison operations and a memorandum stating psychology externs had no contact with Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein in Custody at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as present ('A -PRE') at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. His assignment date is recorded as July 8, 2019.

events.title: Daily Facility Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: The document includes a daily log showing inmate movements (e.g., bail/bond releases, removals, admissions) and an official out-count for inmate Robert Clark at the FNYS facility.

events.title: Epstein's Attorney Visit Assignment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is listed on an inmate roster with an assignment category for attorney visits, indicating he was scheduled or approved for legal consultations.

events.title: MCC Daily Population Counts
events.description: Bureau of Prisons count sheets show the official inmate population at the MCC, with totals around 757-760 inmates across various housing units.

events.title: Continued MCC Administrative Operations
events.description: Administrative records, including count sheets and rosters, continue to be generated, showing routine prison operations.

events.title: FBI Crime Scene Sign-in
events.description: A U.S. Department of Justice crime scene sign-in log page is included, dated August 11, for an unspecified location, with personnel from the FBI listed.

events.title: Evidence Collection at MCC New York
events.description: Bureau of Prisons staff recover evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's cell (Special Housing Unit) and the attorney conference room, including 30-minute rounds sheets and a log book, following his death.

events.title: Epstein Transported to Hospital
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was transported to New York Presbyterian Hospital; clothing from this transport was later collected as evidence.

events.title: Prison inmate counts at MCC New York
events.description: Multiple official and base inmate counts were conducted throughout the day and night across various housing units (General Population) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Evening inmate roster and count
events.description: An inmate roster and official out-count were conducted, listing housing units and inmate totals, with some inmates flagged under 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' operational categories.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York with a status of 'Present' as of July 8, 2019.
The document is a Bureau of Prisons roster and log dated August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death in custody.
The roster contains hundreds of inmate names, registration numbers, assignment dates, and housing unit details, indicating standard prison administrative record-keeping.
Epstein's specific housing assignment is recorded as unit K04N, cell -129L.
A separate section shows daily inmate movements and an official out-count form, reflecting routine prison operations.
Jeffrey Epstein was inmate 76318-054 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in August 2019.
Epstein's specific housing assignment for attorney visits was unit Z04-206LAD, as recorded on multiple rosters from August 5-10, 2019.
The MCC inmate population during this period was approximately 757-760 individuals, as recorded in official count sheets.
The document bundle includes a U.S. Department of Justice crime scene sign-in log dated August 11, 2019, listing FBI personnel, suggesting investigative activity around that time.
Multiple other inmates are listed in daily logs and rosters, showing routine prison administrative functions like movements, assignments, and population counts.
Chain of custody logs were created on August 11, 2019, for evidence recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's MCC cell on August 10, 2019.

Evidence items include 'Special Housing Unit 30 Minute Rounds Sheets' for dates 8/8/19, 8/9/19, and 8/10/19, an 'Attorney Conference Log Book', and 'Clothing Epstein was transported to outside hospital with'.
The logs document a formal evidence handling process involving overnight drop boxes, evidence safes, and multiple witness signatures, indicating a post-incident investigation.
Epstein's Bureau of Prisons registration number is consistently listed as 76318-054 (with one typo as 78318-054).
The evidence was marked for 'Hold as evidence' and in one instance indicates a destination of 'SIS Office', suggesting further investigation by the Special Investigative Supervisor.

A memorandum dated August 13, 2019, states that psychology externs from several universities (John Jay, University of Hartford, Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine, Adelphi University) 'did not have any contact with Mr. Epstein.'
Detailed prison count logs from August 10, 2019, show inmate population numbers in various housing units (e.g., E-S: 79, G-N: 78, G-S: 88) at the MCC, the facility where Epstein was held.
Inmate rosters from August 9, 2019, list operational categories including 'HOSP' and 'SUICIDE OR SUICIDE OR UNASSG' for some inmates.
An 'Evidence Recovery Log' form (BOP form 4-A0973) is included in the document set, though its specific contents related to the case are not detailed in this text chunk.
The documents are administrative records showing standard prison operations (counts, rosters, inventories) from the MCC around the time of Epstein's death.
